main event: On October 15, 1957, Mrs. Elizabeth E. Klima observed a large light phenomenon in the northeastern sky over Basking Ridge, NJ, which she described as appearing larger than the full moon and resembling extraordinary rays of light.
interesting points: The object appeared to change size and intensity, ultimately diminishing and disappearing,The sighting lasted approximately 45 minutes,For a moment, Mrs. Klima dived under a table due to fear but later inspected the area with no unusual findings,The phenomenon was silent, and Mrs. Klima stated she was familiar with such experiences, but this was significantly more luminous and larger than anything previously observed.
sighted object: a large light with rays of light extending in all directions
witness description: Mrs. Elizabeth E. Klima and her daughter
